How can I set a time lock on an identity using the Verus JSON-RPC API?

You can set a time lock on an identity using the `setidentitytimelock` method of the Verus JSON-RPC API. The basic format of this API call is:

```bash
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytimelock", "params": ["id@", '{"unlockatblock":absoluteblockheight || "setunlockdelay":numberofblocksdelayafterunlock}']} -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

This API call takes the same parameters as the command line version: the ID to be locked, and a JSON object specifying the lock parameters. The lock parameters can be either `unlockatblock` (specifying the absolute block height at which the lock will be released) or `setunlockdelay` (specifying the number of blocks to delay after the unlock).

Examples: > verus setidentitytimelock "id@" '{"unlockatblock":absoluteblockheight || "setunlockdelay":numberofblocksdelayafterunlock}' (returntx) > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytimelock", "params": ["id@" '{"unlockatblock":absoluteblockheight || "setunlockdelay":numberofblocksdelayafterunlock}' (returntx)] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
